Package persistence.json.character

Interface CharacterDAO

All Known Implementing Classes:
CharacterAPIDAO, CharacterJsonDAO
public interface CharacterDAO
Interface that abstracts the persistence of characters from uppers.

In particular, it follows the Data Access Object design pattern, which is commonly used to abstract persistence implementations with a set of generic operations.

  • Method Details

    • getAll

      ArrayList<Character> getAll()
      Method that reads the persisted information of all characters.
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of all the characters

    • save

      void save(Character character) throws PersistenceException, IOException
      Method that saves a specific character, persisting its information.
      Parameters:
      character - the character to save
      Throws:
      PersistenceException - if something goes wrong when persisting (writing to the file)
      IOException - if something goes wrong when persisting (writing to the file)

    • getByPlayerName

      ArrayList<Character> getByPlayerName(String playerName) throws PersistenceException, IOException
      Method that reads the persisted information of a set of characters, specifically those that are owned by a specific player.
      Parameters:
      playerName - a string representation of the name to use in the query
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of all the characters owned by the player
      Throws:
      PersistenceException - if something goes wrong when querying the persisted data
      IOException - if something goes wrong when querying the persisted data

    • delete

      boolean delete(Character character) throws PersistenceException, IOException
      Method that deletes a specific character, removing its information.
      Parameters:
      character - the character to delete
      Returns:
      boolean that represents whether the character is deleted or not.
      Throws:
      PersistenceException - if something goes wrong when persisting (reading from / writing to the file)
      IOException - if something goes wrong when persisting (reading from / writing to the file)

    • getByCharacterName

      Character getByCharacterName(String name)
      Method that reads the persisted information of a specific character, specifically the one with a specific name.
      Parameters:
      name - a string representation of the name to use in the query
      Returns:
      the character with the name introduced by the user

    • update

      void update(Character character) throws PersistenceException
      Method that updates a specific character, persisting its information.
      Parameters:
      character - the character to update
      Throws:
      PersistenceException - if something goes wrong when persisting (writing to the file)

    • checkUniqueName

      boolean checkUniqueName(String name)
      Method that checks whether the character's name introduced by the user already exists in the system.
      Parameters:
      name - a string representation of the name inputted by the user
      Returns:
      a boolean representation of whether the name is unique or not.

    • getNumCharacters

      int getNumCharacters()
      Method that gets the number of characters in the system
      Returns:
      an int representation of the characters already stored in the system
